podcast_summary: In the podcast episode titled "Wait, You Shouldn't Drink the Coffee on Airplanes?", host PJ Voatt investigates whether it's true that the coffee and water on airplanes should never be consumed. The investigation starts with a conversation with his friend Anthony Parowski, who warns against drinking the coffee or using the bathroom water on flights. Anthony's concerns stem from his father's experience as an ER physician treating people with eye infections after flying. They also noticed pilots bringing their own water bottles into the bathroom. The conversation leads to the discovery that the coffee and tea served on airplanes are made using the same water as the bathroom sinks. Although there isn't concrete proof, rumors suggest that airplane water tanks are only required to be cleaned once or twice a year. To avoid consuming potentially contaminated water, Anthony shares that he brings his own coffee and water in two Yeti bottles. The episode ends with Anthony's intention to investigate further by asking flight attendants and researching airline guidelines and regulations. To find out the surprising answer reached at the end of the investigation, listeners are encouraged to tune into the podcast episode titled "Wait, You Shouldn't Drink the Coffee on Airplanes?" on the Odyssey app or their preferred podcast platform.
